issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
The title is pretty explanatory, I opened a private HD ticket with an testcase to the real server

http://support.appcelerator.com/tickets/APP-917936/tickets

thank you.
fields.summary: httpClient gives error on device when app compiled with ios6 on a 5.1 device for an url that contains a port

comments.body:
Unable to reproduce with SDK 2.1.3.v20120928203111 with Xcode 4.5/iOS 6.0 target on:
iPhone 4s (5.0.1)
iPhone 4s (6.0)
iPhone 4 (5.1.1)
iPhone 3GS (4.3)

We are seeing no errors in console and server data is returning.

Hi Eric, 
Sorry for asking, but are you sure you tested with the testcase I submitted?

The url you need to go has a different port (included into the url) and also a basic auth header.
So maybe is a combination between this two ?

I'll try to extend the example but I cannot post it here as server data is real and therefore the HD ticket is private.

Thank you

Ok, this is very awkward. 
It is working now without any change. The only thing that can explain is that was some issue with the carrier.
On the laptop I had my landline ISP but on the mobile I was on the mobile connection.
I tested today with more configurations (Edge, 3G, wifi with 2 ISP) and seems to work fine.

Sorry for the mess.
No worries, Mr. Tamas, It's much better to err on the side of caution. Moving that we resolve this as a 'cannot reproduce'.
